headline.main: Light Pre-Election Schedule in Congress Matches Legislative Goals
headline.print_headline: Light Pre-Election Schedule in Congress Matches Legislative Goals

docs.abstract: Members of Congress return to Capitol with as few as seven legislative days remaining before they return home for November midterm elections; legislators have set modest goals for their return, in keeping with brief time period.
docs.snippet: Passing a stopgap spending bill and keeping the Export-Import Bank open are among the modest objectives that lawmakers have set this month.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lava from one of the world's most active volcanos is creeping slowly but steadily through cracks in the earth toward a rural subdivision on Hawaii's Big Island. Scientists warn that if the lava flow from Kilauea continues on its path, it could reach a small patch of homes in about a week.

headline.main: What Does the Middle Class Need?

docs.abstract: Thursday night, Senator Elizabeth Warren and New York Times columnist Paul Krugman sat down to discuss the minimum wage, consumer financial protection, student debt, access to health care and other issues facing our nation’s middle class.

docs.lead_paragraph: Maria Fernandes, a New Jersey woman with three part-time jobs who died while sleeping in her car between shifts, was remembered on Friday as much for her generosity as for becoming the face of millions of struggling U.S. low-wage workers.

headline.main: N.J. Woman With Three Jobs Eulogized as Face of Low-Wage Worker
